result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler David Goggin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

9:51  Defendant Tyler David Goggin in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruling on motion to suppress evidence. Court finds the testimony of Officer Banger is creditable and he believes it and finds it reasonable.  Motion is denied.
from Atty Bub re: medical emergency exception argument.
from Atty Froelich re: argues Srgt Bangert's action by retrieving container and conducting test to emergency medical staff was reasonable and requests motion to suppress be denied.
Motion hearing held on January 19, 2016 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed by RMR T Carlson.
Status conference at 03-28-2016 09:30 am.

11:42 Defendant Tyler David Goggin in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to Suppress filed by Atty Bub. Sgt Scott Bangert swn, ex by Atty Froelich. Atty Bub x ex. Froelich redirect. Court: counsel to prepare written letter brief. 30 days for the State and 15 days after that for Atty Bub. Set for status/decision hearing after the 45 days. Defendant to remain until he is handed a notice of hearing.
Preliminary Hearing, Arraignment held on September 14, 2015 before Court Commissioner Gavic. Filed by RMR T Carlson
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion filed by Atty Bub
Motion hearing at 01-19-2016 11:15 am.
State's.
Pre-trial conference at 11-02-2015 03:15 pm

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court.  Bond to continue in present form.  Set Pre Trial Conference.

1:36 p.m.  Defendant Tyler David Goggin in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant Tyler David Goggin in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich calls Scott Bangert.  Bangert is sworn and takes the stand.  Froelich examines Bangert.  Bangert identifies defendant.  Bub cross-examines Bangert.  Froelich calls Travis Rudesill.  Rudesill is sworn and takes the stand.  Froelich examines Rudesill.  Rudesill identifies defendant.  Bub cross-examines Rudesill. Froelich gives argument and asks court to bind defendant over for trial.  Bub gives argument and asks court dismiss charge.  Froelich gives additional argument and asks for bind over.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
BUB
Preliminary hearing at 09-14-2015 01:30 pm
